Comment: Simple, good clash. ðŸ‘

Thank you to the people who approved my CoC. If other coders want to test the approval limit and break codingame, don't hesitate :)
To be honest, I initially wrote this because it's part of the â€˜Contributionâ€™ path, I agree it's not very glorious. Even if in the end I had fun imagining and writing this little challenge, I'm not forgetting the origin of my motivation.
That's why I'm inviting you, if and only if you think the CoC deserves it, to upvote the contribution with the aim of reaching 5.
Thank you for your support.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Oops I cannot keep myself from checking the limit on approvers. And, fun clash, deserves approval.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Well described, easily solvable, and the test cases allow to understand what in going on for the Reverse mode => Good clash

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good clash.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: good short clash

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: le sujet est pertinent et fun

Looks good so far.

Please follow the advice given by @5DN1L below, and your contribution will be improved in both formatting and clarity.

Goal
* Please specify which letters are considered as vowels in this clash. Please format those letters as {{constants}}.

* Please either delete the example (because an example has been shown in Example section), or add some explanation to it.

Input
* Please change "sentence" to "string".

Output
* Please change "sentence" to "string".

* Please change "is no output" to "are no letters in [[stc]]".

* Please delete the quotation marks around "empty".

Constraints
* Please change "0" to "1".

* Please fix the typo: "lenght" => "length".

* Please change "s" to "stc".

Cases
* Please remove all non-ASCII characters ("â‚¬" and "Â§") in the input. These characters can't be shown properly in the CodinGame console, and may cause an issue when debugging.

Alternatively, you may change those characters to some ASCII characters.

Thanks.

Thank you for your very pertinent comments.
If there are still typos because my English is bad or something else, don't hesitate to let me know.
I think pekkapitaine04 has updated his proposal

Hah ok let me give you the fifth upvote. Because, it is simply a nice clash that fits the requirements: short enough, while just being challenging enough to make it fun. Also, all of the modes will be fun: reverse is doable and challenging, fastest is just fine, shortest will be a nice challenge as well.

We're at 6... And we have 5 days remaining... Let's reach more! \o/
Like... 17? xD (which is of course a perfectly randomly chosen number... right?)

There has been an update with the approval of clashes.

If a clash has been approved within 7 days of it's publication, it will not be finished approving.

For example, this clash has 30 days remaining for approval. If I were to approve along with you, then the author would have to wait for 7 days before his contribution would be accepted into the community's database.

In this period if 3 people reject it, it will be rejected outright.
Yes, I'm aware of that. We'll just have to wait 7 days from publication for the approval to take effect.

No worries!

Two points to follow up:

Output
* Please delete the quotation marks around "empty".

Cases
* "Special characters Validator": Please delete "Â¨" in the input as it is not an ASCII character.

Thanks.

You really can't miss a thing ! 
Thank you for your exemplary responsiveness.
